column1: Use a backup method of birth control, such as condom, diaphragm, or sponge if: - You miss 1 or more pills.
Tell your health care provider or pharmacist if you take any other medicines, such as antibiotics, seizure medicine, medicine to treat HIV, or St.

Call your health care provider if you have any of the following symptoms after starting to take the birth control pills: - You have swelling in your leg - You have leg pain - Your leg feels warm to the touch or has changes in skin color - You have fever or chills - You are short of breath and it is hard to breathe - You have chest pain - You cough up blood - You have a headache that gets worse, especially a migraine with aura
